abstract: Rachel Saltz reviews movie A Trick of the Light, directed by Wim Wenders in collaboration with students of the University of Television and Film Munich.
lead_paragraph: Wim Wenders’s fiction-documentary hybrid introduces the Skladanowsky brothers, who shot playful scenes with a hand-cranked camera they invented in the 1890s.

headline.main: Review: In ‘A Trick of the Light,’ the German Answer to the Lumière Brothers
headline.print_headline: Review: In ‘A Trick of the Light,’ the German Answer to the Lumière Brothers

snippet: Wim Wenders’s fiction-documentary hybrid introduces the Skladanowsky brothers, who shot playful scenes with a hand-cranked camera they invented in the 1890s.
